newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly up.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly up.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Thursday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover rose to 1.559 billion yuan from 1.496 million on Tuesday and the most active one was the 30-day contract.
Traders said Thursday's trading volume was thin as the death of Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping made most financial institutions reluctant to build positions.
"Reports about Deng's deteriorating health had been circulating for days, depressing market activity," said one trader. "Turnover was thin today after his death was confirmed."
Traders said they expect the interbank rates to move in a narrow range in slow trading in the short-term before the negative imapct of Deng's death is completely digested.
